00121 #ifndef _osapi_filesys_
00122 #define _osapi_filesys_
00123 #include <stdio.h>
00124 #include <stdlib.h>
00125 #include <dirent.h>
00126 #include <sys/stat.h>
00127 
00128 #define OS_READ_ONLY        0
00129 #define OS_WRITE_ONLY       1
00130 #define OS_READ_WRITE       2
00131 
00132 #define OS_SEEK_SET         0
00133 #define OS_SEEK_CUR         1
00134 #define OS_SEEK_END         2
00135 
00136 #define OS_CHK_ONLY         0
00137 #define OS_REPAIR           1
00138 
00139 #define FS_BASED            0
00140 #define RAM_DISK            1
00141 #define EEPROM_DISK         2
00142 #define ATA_DISK            3
00143 
00144 
00145 /*
00146 ** Number of entries in the internal volume table
00147 */
00148 #define NUM_TABLE_ENTRIES 14
00149 
00150 /*
00151 ** Length of a Device and Volume name 
00152 */
00153 #define OS_FS_DEV_NAME_LEN  32
00154 #define OS_FS_PHYS_NAME_LEN 64
00155 #define OS_FS_VOL_NAME_LEN  32
00156 
00157 
00158 /*
00159 ** Defines for File System Calls
00160 */
00161 #define OS_FS_SUCCESS                    0
00162 #define OS_FS_ERROR                    (-1)
00163 #define OS_FS_ERR_INVALID_POINTER      (-2) 
00164 #define OS_FS_ERR_PATH_TOO_LONG        (-3)
00165 #define OS_FS_ERR_NAME_TOO_LONG        (-4)
00166 #define OS_FS_UNIMPLEMENTED            (-5) 
00167 #define OS_FS_ERR_DRIVE_NOT_CREATED    (-6)
00168 #define OS_FS_ERR_DEVICE_NOT_FREE      (-7)
00169 #define OS_FS_ERR_PATH_INVALID         (-8)
00170 #define OS_FS_ERR_NO_FREE_FDS          (-9)
00171 #define OS_FS_ERR_INVALID_FD           (-10)
00172 
00173 /* This typedef is for the OS_FS_GetErrorName function, to ensure
00174  * everyone is making an array of the same length */
00175 
00176 typedef char os_fs_err_name_t[35];
00177 
00178 
00179 /*
00180 ** Internal structure of the OS volume table for 
00181 ** mounted file systems and path translation
00182 */
00183 typedef struct
00184 {
00185     char   DeviceName [OS_FS_DEV_NAME_LEN];
00186     char   PhysDevName [OS_FS_PHYS_NAME_LEN];
00187     uint32 VolumeType;
00188     uint8  VolatileFlag;
00189     uint8  FreeFlag;
00190     uint8  IsMounted;
00191     char   VolumeName [OS_FS_VOL_NAME_LEN];
00192     char   MountPoint [OS_MAX_PATH_LEN];
00193     uint32 BlockSize;
00194 
00195 }OS_VolumeInfo_t;
00196 
00197 typedef struct
00198 {
00199     int32   OSfd;                   /* The underlying OS's file descriptor */
00200     char    Path[OS_MAX_PATH_LEN];  /* The path of the file opened */
00201     uint32   User;                  /* The task id of the task who opened the file*/
00202     uint8   IsValid;                /* Whether or not this entry is valid */
00203 }OS_FDTableEntry;
00204 
00205 typedef struct
00206 {
00207    uint32   MaxFds;                /* Total number of file descriptors */
00208    uint32   FreeFds;               /* Total number that are free */
00209    uint32   MaxVolumes;            /* Maximum number of volumes */
00210    uint32   FreeVolumes;           /* Total number of volumes free */
00211 } os_fsinfo_t; 
00212 
00213 /* modified to posix calls, since all of the 
00214  * applicable OSes use the posix calls */
00215 
00216 typedef struct stat         os_fstat_t;
00217 typedef DIR*                os_dirp_t;
00218 typedef struct dirent       os_dirent_t;
00219 /* still don't know what this should be*/
00220 typedef unsigned long int   os_fshealth_t;

00227 /******************************************************************************
00228 ** Standard File system API
00229 ******************************************************************************/
00230 /*
00231  * Initializes the File System functions 
00232 */
00233 
00234 int32           OS_FS_Init(void);
00235 
00236 /*
00237  * Creates a file specified by path
00238 */
00239 int32           OS_creat  (const char *path, int32  access);
00240 
00241 /*
00242  * Opend a file for reading/writing. Returns file descriptor
00243 */
00244 int32           OS_open   (const char *path,  int32 access,  uint32 mode);
00245 
00246 /*
00247  * Closes an open file.
00248 */
00249 int32           OS_close  (int32  filedes);
00250 
00251 /*
00252  * Reads nbytes bytes from file into buffer
00253 */
00254 int32           OS_read   (int32  filedes, void *buffer, uint32 nbytes);
00255 
00256 /*
00257  * Write nybytes bytes of buffer into the file
00258 */
00259 int32           OS_write  (int32  filedes, void *buffer, uint32 nbytes);
00260 
00261 /*
00262  * Changes the permissions of a file
00263 */
00264 int32           OS_chmod  (const char *path, uint32 access);
00265 
00266 /*
00267  * Returns file status information in filestats
00268 */
00269 int32           OS_stat   (const char *path, os_fstat_t  *filestats);
00270 
00271 /*
00272  * Seeks to the specified position of an open file 
00273 */
00274 int32           OS_lseek  (int32  filedes, int32 offset, uint32 whence);
00275 
00276 /*
00277  * Removes a file from the file system
00278 */
00279 int32           OS_remove (const char *path);
00280 
00281 /*
00282  * Renames a file in the file system
00283 */
00284 int32           OS_rename (const char *old_filename, const char *new_filename);
00285 
00286 /* 
00287  * copies a single file from src to dest
00288 */
00289 int32 OS_cp (const char *src, const char *dest);
00290 
00291 /* 
00292  * moves a single file from src to dest
00293 */
00294 int32 OS_mv (const char *src, const char *dest);
00295 
00296 /*
00297  * Copies the info of an open file to the structure
00298 */
00299 int32 OS_FDGetInfo (int32 filedes, OS_FDTableEntry *fd_prop);
00300 
00301 /*
00302 ** Check to see if a file is open
00303 */
00304 int32 OS_FileOpenCheck(char *Filename);
00305 
00306 /*
00307 ** Close all open files
00308 */
00309 int32 OS_CloseAllFiles(void);
00310 
00311 /*
00312 ** Close a file by filename
00313 */
00314 int32 OS_CloseFileByName(char *Filename);
00315

00317 /******************************************************************************
00318 ** Directory API 
00319 ******************************************************************************/
00320 
00321 /*
00322  * Makes a new directory
00323 */
00324 int32           OS_mkdir   (const char *path, uint32 access);
00325 
00326 /*
00327  * Opens a directory for searching
00328 */
00329 os_dirp_t       OS_opendir (const char *path);
00330 
00331 /*
00332  * Closes an open directory
00333 */
00334 int32           OS_closedir(os_dirp_t directory);
00335 
00336 /*
00337  * Rewinds an open directory
00338 */
00339 void           OS_rewinddir(os_dirp_t directory);
00340 
00341 /*
00342  * Reads the next object in the directory
00343 */
00344 os_dirent_t *   OS_readdir (os_dirp_t directory);
00345 
00346 /*
00347  * Removes an empty directory from the file system.
00348 */
00349 int32           OS_rmdir   (const char *path);
00350 
00351 /******************************************************************************
00352 ** System Level API 
00353 ******************************************************************************/
00354 /*
00355  * Makes a file system
00356 */
00357 int32           OS_mkfs        (char *address,char *devname, char *volname,
00358                                 uint32 blocksize, uint32 numblocks);
00359 /*
00360  * Mounts a file system
00361 */
00362 int32           OS_mount       (const char *devname, char *mountpoint);
00363 
00364 /*
00365  * Initializes an existing file system
00366 */
00367 int32           OS_initfs      (char *address,char *devname, char *volname,
00368                                 uint32 blocksize, uint32 numblocks);
00369 
00370 /*
00371  * removes a file system 
00372 */
00373 int32           OS_rmfs        (char *devname);
00374 
00375 /*
00376  * Unmounts a mounted file system
00377 */
00378 int32           OS_unmount     (const char *mountpoint);
00379 
00380 /*
00381  * Returns the number of free blocks in a file system
00382 */
00383 int32           OS_fsBlocksFree (const char *name);
00384 
00385 /*
00386 ** Returns the number of free bytes in a file system 
00387 ** Note the 64 bit data type to support filesystems that
00388 ** are greater than 4 Gigabytes
00389 */
00390 int32 OS_fsBytesFree (const char *name, uint64 *bytes_free);
00391 
00392 /*
00393  * Checks the health of a file system and repairs it if neccesary
00394 */
00395 os_fshealth_t   OS_chkfs       (const char *name, boolean repair);
00396 
00397 /*
00398  * Returns in the parameter the physical drive underneith the mount point 
00399 */
00400 int32       OS_FS_GetPhysDriveName  (char * PhysDriveName, char * MountPoint);
00401 
00402 /*
00403 ** Translates a OSAL Virtual file system path to a host Local path
00404 */
00405 int32       OS_TranslatePath ( const char *VirtualPath, char *LocalPath);
00406 
00407 /*             
00408 **  Returns information about the file system in an os_fsinfo_t
00409 */
00410 int32       OS_GetFsInfo(os_fsinfo_t  *filesys_info);
00411 
00412 /******************************************************************************
00413 ** Shell API
00414 ******************************************************************************/
00415 
00416 /* executes the shell command passed into is and writes the output of that 
00417  * command to the file specified by the given OSAPI file descriptor */
00418 int32 OS_ShellOutputToFile(char* Cmd, int32 OS_fd);
